The people that benefit from this app are the frequent BP users, pretty much all of whom would be swiping their Velocity cards.  If it’s not ready don’t launch it, it gives your valued frequent customers the appearance that they’re not valued after all...

title: No live prices, no thanks.
review: The biggest downside compared to competitors apps is the lack of a live price board. Until that arrives I I’ll be uninstalling. It could also do with some basic finishing touches. This is what I experienced from the sign up process. When entering my name it wasn’t automatically capitalised. When creating a password if you use Safari’s Suggest Password option you cannot auto fill that password when trying to log in to the app. The workaround is to go into iPhone settings and get it out of there. But when you switch back to the BP app it wipes your email address so you have to type it in again. Then after pasting the password the login button doesn’t allow you to click it. The workaround for that is to backspace and type the last character of the password. But again when switching between the app and settings the page is wiped and you need to start over. How frustrating!
developerResponse: {'id': 2105236, 'body': "Hi chipper, BPme doesn't list fuel prices, the price you'll pay per litre is shown on the price board at the front of the servo as well as on the bowser. At this stage we have no plans to integrate fuel pricing into the app. With regards to your other issues, we will pass these on to the developers.", 'modified': '2017-12-22T04:23:58Z'}

title: Worst experience ever
review: After using the app for the first time, I can safely say that I won’t be using it again. After sitting in my car, waiting for the app to find my location and then selecting the pump number, it took about another minute before the pump was actually unlocked and the app to tell to commence filling up my car. Once I had finished refuelling, I return the fuel hose and jumped into my car. Here the screen was still stuck on a loading screen. Waiting for the next screen to pop up confirming that the transaction had been paid for. This screen took another couple minutes just sitting there. So I sat in my car again. Not wanting to drive away not paying for fuel. Frustrated, I went into the shop and told the attendant my issue, that I’m not sure if I’ve paid yet and that if he can confirm. The response I was greeted with was deplorable. Absolutely rude. “You’re using the app. I don’t know why you came in for. You’re wasting your time and my time now. Just go”. Angrily, I just left immediately. Disgusted. Only till I drove down the road away from the fuel station, the screen changed and showed a payment confirmation screen. There needs to be some confidence in this system, as I don’t want to have the police called to my house down the track for doing a runner. Endless amounts of time are just spent waiting in the car, instead of just going into the shop. People behind me in the queue waiting to fill up are getting angry, that I’m just sitting here doing nothing in my car. Time of incident:. 18/12/17, 08:27:17
developerResponse: {'id': 2065274, 'body': 'Hi Andy, this is not the customer experience or service we strive for at BP. Can you please confirm the location and approximate time, so we can look into this as a priority. Thank you.', 'modified': '2017-12-18T11:16:52Z'}

title: Possibly the worst app of 2017
review: Wow. Want to see an app that promises so much and delivers totally zero? This is it. Possibly the worst app of 2017. If you survive registering (twice) and logging in (twice) being switched from app to clunky web interface and back... once you do get in just try searching for your nearest BP and watch the app hang and do nothing! Amazing a multi-national conglomerate can stuff this up so hugely! Oh, and if you do manage to level up to some functionality, experience your expectations plummet as you realise not all BP stations actually take part in the app anyway. I’ll use Shell instead, thanks. What a turkey.
developerResponse: {'id': 2105203, 'body': "Hi stezza, we're sorry to hear you had this experience and thank you for letting us know, our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience. BPme is available at over 500 (and rising) BP stations across the country, and likely to build to 700+ stations in the new year. To check your nearest BPme enabled station, find the nearest BP participating station in the Station Finder.", 'modified': '2017-12-22T04:16:25Z'}

title: It didn’t work
review: This didn’t work for me. I selected the right pump and unlocked it, filled the fuel, and then drove off. It didn’t work, the transaction wasn’t recorded, and I had to come back to the BP station and wait 10 minutes for them to try and figure it out. They couldn’t figure it out. I paid with the credit card in store. If it worked I think I would have liked it. But I’m not trying it again.

title: Time Waster
review: Absolute garbage app. Two tries both terrible experience.  Need to fiddle around with setting up BEFORE even starting to fill.  Not good when there are a dozen cars waiting behind you.  (Im not talking about the one time registration which goes without saying needs to be completed, I’m talking about the need to connect to the station, choose a pump and wait for the start filling prompt before you can get started and this all happens slow) Then when done the app doesn’t switch from the fill now prompt, to payment processing.  Have to go inside and have them manually acknowledge the purchase before it will continue.  Also no Velocity points using the app. Even if it was capable of processing a purchase without needing to go inside, it is not a time saver by the time you go through pre-fill setup, fill and then process payment.  Driving in and needing to setup a pump connection and wait for the you can now fill, then when done going back to the app a second time and spending the same time again to process the payment doesn’t cut it. The expectation, especially if it is going to save any time, is you drive in fill up then open the app choose the pump and process the outstanding balance. As mentioned, in my experience, every visit has also required going in, getting in the queue and having them fiddle around on the computer to get the payment to start processing in the app.
developerResponse: {'id': 2109087, 'body': "Hi --000--000--, we're sorry to hear you had this experience and thank you for letting us know. Our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience and we will pass this on to the developers. Regarding registration, BPme has been developed to make your life a little bit easier, but we still  want to ensure your personal details are safe and correct, which is why there are a few steps to registering for BPme. Make sure you have the app downloaded to your smartphone and your payment details added to make refuelling faster on the go. You can also continue to use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP. Please watch this space for new BPme features in the future. Thanks.", 'modified': '2017-12-22T11:39:20Z'}
review_basic_clean: Absolute garbage app Two try terrible experience Need fiddle around setting BEFORE even starting fill Not good dozen car waiting behind Im talking one time registration go without saying need completed Im talking need connect station choose pump wait start filling prompt get started happens slow Then done app doesnt switch fill prompt payment processing Have go inside manually acknowledge purchase continue Also Velocity point using app Even capable processing purchase without needing go inside time saver time go prefill setup fill process payment Driving needing setup pump connection wait fill done going back app second time spending time process payment doesnt cut The expectation especially going save time drive fill open app choose pump process outstanding balance As mentioned experience every visit also required going getting queue fiddle around computer get payment start processing app

title: Works great, but...
review: Just used BPme for the first time and it worked great. As intended.  Very convenient.  Great tech. However.  As I was about to get back into my car, I felt a sudden sense of dread that those around me might think I was doing a runner without paying. For that reason, I caught the eye of the attendant who gave me a nod to confirm everything was fine and with that, I was on my way. I love my tech and this will make me use BP more often in the future, but hopefully without the dread. Great work BP.
developerResponse:
{'id': 2142785, 'body': "Hi CoFRMaverick,
Thank you very much for your feedback, we are so happy to hear that!
We expect paying for your fuel using BPme to quickly become a ‘new norm’ at our sites. The app technology enables us to link the petrol bowser to the mobile wallet the app; so yes it is a bit like magic. Please feel free to continue to catch a staff member's eye if you would like. Thanks again. BPMe has been developed to make everyday life for Aussies a little bit easier, so we're glad you can enjoy the benefits.
Cheers", 'modified': '2017-12-27T10:48:11Z'}

title: App Launched To Soon
review: Installing the app is no problem. But getting to use it is another matter, because for this to happen you need to find a BP site that supports it. We live on the Mornington Peninsula and with just one supported site which doesn’t even include the two Mega sites on Peninsula Link it’s hardly worth the bother. With all the advertising on TV to get the app, I figure their App Store review section  is going to be riddled with complaints!. Obviously BP have lunches the app well before they have even 1/4 of their stores supporting across Melb from what the app shows it’s a shame because we thought it was a great idea.
developerResponse: {'id': 2173226, 'body': 'Hi Nailag62, \nWe are sorry to hear that you are disappointed and thank you for interest in BPme. title: The Customer Service responses seem....
review: ....a bit cut and pasted. Telling customers with legit grievances that great things are planned for the future of this app and to “Watch this space”  when they are spilling out how the app’s non-performance or underfunction is eating their cash and time is absurd. It sounds like something Donald Trump would say, and that isn’t good. Obviously, if the baseline purpose of the launch was ONLY to provide folks the ability to locate a station and pay easily, without headaches, but not to provide for Velocity points (which for some folks is their first and best reason to use BP) then the app still is a fail because folks aren’t able to fulfill the first criteria. You should repeal the app, bring it up to speed properly, then re-release it. Folks don’t like being jerked around just for BP marketing purposes.
developerResponse: {'id': 2231899, 'body': "Hi there,\nThanks for your detailed review. title: Just works, thank you BP
review: A little tricky to setup for me, mainly because I assumed I could create a single account for the family (not so).  Then I accidentally entered the wrong PayPal account which I tried to change but couldn’t, but then figured out later I could delete it and then newly enter the correct account (sigh). At first use at the fuel station I was pleasantly surprised it was very easy and quick to use. Finger print login super easy. Pump selection could be easier, sorry but using Apple’s list scroller is not the best way to pick a simple pump number (lost a Star). Everything else worked amazingly smoothly and quickly. I love the fact that the map shows which stations do and do not support BPme.   This app hands down beats the USA method of using credit cards at the pump. Fantastic job BP, thank you for making my life easier with young ones in the back seat.
developerResponse: {'id': 2290755, 'body': "Hi DopeyBear681, we're so happy to hear that! BPme has been developed to make everyday life for Aussies a little bit easier, so we're glad you can enjoy the benefits. Cheers.", 'modified': '2018-01-13T23:42:08Z'}

title: Scary! But cool!
review: Just used the app for the first time, registration was a breeze when using PayPal to set up. Kinda sucked that I needed to sign into PayPal twice (once on sign up and again on selecting payment method). Other than that it was a breeze. Its really scary using this app because it feels like I just stole petrol lol (I had to check my receipt several times to make sure I paid for my petrol before leaving). I love the concept of this app, wish it had velocity points though! But, to the future!!
developerResponse: {'id': 2303397, 'body': 'Hi Joshua, we are glad to hear that and thanks very much for your feedback. We expect paying for your fuel using BPme to quickly become a ‘new norm’ at our sites. The app technology enables us to link the petrol bowser to the mobile wallet the app; so yes it is a bit like magic. The app also notifies the site staff that payment has been made. We will have plenty of signage at our sites about the new app and of course our staff know all about BPme. Customers can still give a little wave or thumbs up to staff if they’d like. With Velocity, we are committed to evolving and improving our unique new offer over time. New features and functionality for BPme will be made available in the future. Cheers.', 'modified': '2018-01-15T12:11:00Z'}

title: Time saver - rewards
review: Setting up my account and adding a payment option was easy and relatively fast. Used the app at the bowser yesterday and all went smoothly and quickly.  The “pay for fuel” tab was self explanatory and easy to navigate. Currently no option to link Velocity points (lost a rating star for that). I understand velocity cards can still be used in-store but this defeats the purpose of the app in my opinion. From reading other previous reviews of this app it is quite clear that many consumers (myself included) believe this feature should have been included in the initial release, not been left as an afterthought with a promise that “the app is under constant development and more features will be added in the future”. It currently feels like we are “missing out” on a reward we would have otherwise be offered. All round a great app and keen to see the rewards link option soon.
developerResponse: {'id': 2331425, 'body': 'Hi there, we appreciate your praise with regards to the core functionality of the app and fully understand your stance regarding Velocity integration, we understand that the inability to claim Velocity Points via the app is a drawback for many of our customers. As you’ve pointed out, though, we are working on bringing new features to the app which will hopefully bring with them a better customer experience. Once again, we appreciate the time you’ve taken to rate our app.', 'modified': '2018-01-18T02:41:09Z'}

title: Great idea, poor execution
review: Excellent creativity on BPs behalf creating an app such as this. I have been waiting for fuel stations to design an app to streamline what can be a painful process in filling up, especially when you’ve forgotten, the tank is low, and you need to be somewhere in a hurry. Unfortunately the app is far too slow and not at enough BP stations as of yet, and it is almost just as easy to pay in store. Sitting in the car watching the screen load is frustrating when I could be out there putting fuel in my car. I am using an iPhone X so the phone shouldn’t be the issue. Also the lack of velocity support is weird as that has been a big advertising push by BP over the past year or so. Hopefully I have just had a couple of average experiences so far and will continue to use and re review when and if they add velocity support
developerResponse: {'id': 2353503, 'body': "Hi Melant, thanks for your interest in BPme and we're sorry to hear about your experience. We are looking into this further to understand what caused this. Our app developers are constantly working behind the scenes to ensure our customers have the best user experience and we will pass this on to the developers. For the initial BPme launch, we have introduced the fuel payment function to help customers save time. BPme is transformational and we are planning a whole range of exciting new offers to make our customers lives easier. You can continue to use your Velocity Frequent Flyer card in-store to earn and redeem points on fuel and retail purchases at BP. Watch this space for new features in the future. BPme is now available at over 600 BP stations across the country, and is likely to grow to over 700 stations in the new year. You can check your nearest nearest BP participating station in the Station Finder in the app. Thanks.", 'modified': '2018-01-20T22:37:28Z'}

title: Dennis
review: Great concept but needs work, firstly it’s very slow to “unlock the pump”. I also had an issue with the app not switching from the “pump now” screen to the payment confirmation. I closed the app in the multitasking menu which seemed to make this happen, the only reason I knew payment went though was because my credit card sent me a push notification of a recent payment to BP. Maybe you should consider enabling a push notification as an indicator that it has gone through and you’re fine to force off? It all felt too slow and clunky, would have spent the same time walking into store and laying at one of the self serve kiosks. Also find it very ridiculous that the app doesn’t support velocity, and a reason I won’t be using the app moving forward considering I am only loyal to BP for Velocity Points...

title: No Velocity, no deal
review: Does what it says on the tin but disappointing none the less. Email receipts are handy but assumed that Velocity would be included as a baseline feature, sadly I was disappointed - should have read the reviews first. The most recent patch added nothing but the option to volunteer for extra marketing emails. If I was the developer responsible I'd be ashamed of myself. title: Looks great but doesn’t work!
review: I went to use the app for the first time today after setting up the app about a week ago. Logged in with my PIN once I got to the servo, told it what pump I was at and it said I was good to go!. Put fuel in my car and drove away! Then the app said “there was an issue, keep driving and we will contact you later”. Ahhhhh did I just drive away without paying?? Got a txt about 10 minutes later asking to tap the link and to pay for the fuel. Which I did (with the same card that didn’t work in the app). Thought I would go in and check the card details which I couldn’t do so I just deleted the card details and went to re-enter them. Now the app doesn’t want to take my card details. What a waste of time!
developerResponse: {'id': 2526227, 'body': 'Hi Craig, what you did in that instance is correct, if the connection to the payment service drops it will attempt to reconnect whilst you are on your way and the text that you received will be sent if the app cannot reconnect to take payment. title: Told me to leave station, lucky I didn’t.
review: My first time using the app on way to work to save time. Unlocked the pump quick. Filled up car, sat waiting for confirmation, eventually a pop up told me delay in sending email receipt and I could leave station.  Thought I better go in and check. Guy was frantically going between two terminals and told me he couldn’t get it to go through.  Eventually paid on card after he assured me I wouldn’t be charged twice.  Was late for work as it took twice as long as normal.  Was soo hoping this app would be a good timesaver but I’m apprehensive to try it again.  It really needs to be a cloud system rather than needing an operator in store to manually process it, defeats the purpose imo.
developerResponse: {'id': 2554804, 'body': "Hi Cosmic, sorry for the inconvenience. It sounds as though this particular BP is independently owned and operated. developerResponse: {'id': 2697197, 'body': 'Hi Shez, BPme is free to download, however  as with many mobile payment apps, there is a $1 pre authorisation hold by your financial provider to ensure the method is valid every time you authorise a payment (regardless of its success or failure). title: Needs improvement
review: The initial setup process is too long and switches between the app & online. I also made the mistake the first time of filling up before launching the app and then had to wait for the store person to override it before it would process my payment. Made it half way to the register before that happened. There should be an option come up to select whether you have filled up already or not. Used it today for the second time and remembered to open the app first but even though the app says the pump is released and able to be used you still have to wait until the store person releases it before you can fill up. Also massive lag between finishing and the payment being approved. I actually got my emailed receipt before the app showed that payment had been made & I could drive off. It is good to not have to get all of the kids out of the car to pay for fuel but with all the lags it doesn’t actually save much time. Disappointing also that not all places accept the app.
developerResponse: {'id': 2785156, 'body': 'Hi Gio12344321, thank you for your detailed feedback and suggestions. Regarding the unlocking of the pump, thank you for letting us know- it is not the customer service experience we aim for at our BP stations. If you could please provide more information such as the specific station, time and date of the transaction I will be able to pass it onto the relevant team to investigate further. Regarding approval of payment, thanks for your feedback, we are looking into this further to understand what caused this. The app is available at over 600 (and rising) BP stations across the country, and likely to build to 700+ stations in 2018. To check your nearest BPme enabled station, simply download the app and find the nearest BP participating station in the Station Finder. Thanks.', 'modified': '2018-03-09T10:16:50Z'}

title: Great idea
review: Installed the app about a week ago and haven’t used it yet. Had an initial problem with a “unauthorised transaction” but that has been satisfactorily resolved (it was my bank that did this). So I have updated my initial review.
developerResponse: {'id': 2809895, 'body': 'Hi there, BPme is free to download, however  as with many mobile payment apps, there is a $1 pre authorisation hold by your financial provider to ensure the method is valid every time you authorise a payment (regardless of its success or failure). This will be released by your financial provider. Your financial provider will be able to give you more information on how long it will take to be released, but generally for financial cards like VISA, AMEX and MasterCard, the pre authorisation hold will be released from the account within 3-10 days. With all PayPal transactions, your account will show the $1 pre authorisation hold for 29 days and will feature as a pending payment in your account.\n\nWe suggest you contact your bank if you have further questions.', 'modified': '2018-03-13T03:35:54Z'}

Twice I’ve had the message that something’s gone wrong, by all means leave the station and we’ll continue trying to process payment. I used to have a PIN set up for easy access. After an update apparently I now need to log in with my full credentials and security question every time I want to use it. Would love to see Velocity added to the app. Not sure why it can’t be. I use this as a mother with a baby, it is a godsend to not have to get her out of the car for fuel but then I am missing out on points. Overall though it’s a reasonable app.

title: Slow and they charged you extra
review: Apps is really slow and unresponsive which means it takes your time. But the saddest part is they charged me extra for fuelling up when the card was decline (not my fault but they guy behind the counter pressed 95 instead of 98). So i was fuelling up at bp summer hill, so i started the apps and wait for the apps to load (which is slow) and followed their instruction by choosing the station and pump number. I then proceed to fill up my car and wait till it approve. However, it got declined. So i went in and ask the gentleman behind the counter. He claimed that i paid which i went to my banking apps and my account still hasnt been deducted in full. However they deduct $1 off me (till this day i dont know whats that for. And no this is not the first time im using it). So the person behind the counter was confused and he called his manager and they were talking in their language which i couldnt understand and he hung up and told me to just drive and BP will contact me so i being paranoid i told him to take my mobile number just incase. He admitted that he pressed a wrong fuel type prior of me fuelling up. I left and couple hours later, i received a message from BP to pay my account via a link but when i checked they charge me another $3 for a mistake that i didnt even do. I dont think this is right i mean $4 dollar to use an app that supposedly make your life easier. Sorry if i sound like a cheapskate but i just fuelled up for 20 dollar so it doesnt really make sense. I hope BP review their apps and train their managers to actually get the information across to their staffs.
developerResponse: {'id': 3008328, 'body': "Hi there, thank you for your feedback about what you experienced, it is not the customer service experience we aim for at our BP stations. Your feedback has also been forwarded to our Area Manager specific to that station for further investigation and to undertake any appropriate action. With regards to being charged extra for the CSR's mistake, please contact us on 1300 1300 27; following the prompts for BPme so we can assist further.", 'modified': '2018-04-03T02:10:44Z'}
review_basic_clean: Apps really slow unresponsive mean take time But saddest part charged extra fuelling card decline fault guy behind counter pressed instead So fuelling bp summer hill started apps wait apps load slow followed instruction choosing station pump number I proceed fill car wait till approve However got declined So went ask gentleman behind counter He claimed paid went banking apps account still hasnt deducted full However deduct till day dont know whats And first time im using So person behind counter confused called manager talking language couldnt understand hung told drive BP contact paranoid told take mobile number incase He admitted pressed wrong fuel type prior fuelling I left couple hour later received message BP pay account via link checked charge another mistake didnt even I dont think right mean dollar use app supposedly make life easier Sorry sound like cheapskate fuelled dollar doesnt really make sense I hope BP review apps train manager actually get information across staff
Key Phrases: wrong fuel type, bp summer hill, saddest part, pump number, mobile number, first time, banking apps, card, fault, counter, instruction, station, gentleman, account, person, manager, language, message, link, mistake, dollar, life, cheapskate, sense, information, staffs

title: Velocity Rewards
review: I have used the app and see the potential being very smart. Unfortunately I won’t use it again because it still doesn’t incorporate the Velocity Rewards points. I have spoken with BP Customer Service and they inform me of receiving many complaints about the same thing. BP now have an App that lets us do more while they benefit from doing less. If anything we should get bonus points for using the App. I see a response from 18 Jan but no action yet. If BP wants to make this project a success then get things moving by incorporating Rewards.
developerResponse: {'id': 3001543, 'body': 'Hi Riptoffff, thanks for following this up and apologies we have not given you an more recent update. We are still working through this and it is our aim to bring additional BPme features and benefits to our customers as soon as possible. We appreciate your ongoing patience while we work through this. When new functionality is available we will communicate with BPme users via the app and also our website and social media. Thanks.', 'modified': '2018-04-02T09:45:42Z'}

title: Why can’t a BP Fuel Card be used?
review: Why can’t a BP Fuel Card be used?
developerResponse:
{'id': 4637984, 'body': "Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to contact BP. 

BP has a dedicated app for BP Plus card holders called ‘BP Plus Fuel Card - BPme’, which has unique features and benefits for our BP Plus card customers.

At present, the app is not available for BP Plus cards issued from large fleet, leasing and salary sacrifice companies. Communication will be sent out from your BP Plus card issuer when this feature is available. 

You can read more about the' BP Plus Fuel Card - BPme' on the website https://www.bp.com/en_au/australia/products-services/bpme/bpme-for-bp-plus.html

If you have any further queries regarding BPMe, please contact us as below.

Kind regards,
BPme Customer Care

My biggest complaint is how long it takes from when you pull along a pump, start the app waiting for it to prompt you to sign in (I use Touch ID) then select the pump. The app was meant to be a convenience feature so make it faster and truly convenient.

title: Waste of Time
review: Don’t bother with this app, you spend longer fighting with it than if you had just walked up to pay (you have to get out of the car to fill up anyway). It tries to solve the problem we have nowadays with lining up, except that in this apps case it doesn’t save you any time as you can’t preorder, you have to be at the pump and you have to wait for the operator to be available to enable the pump. If the operator is available to do so then they weren’t busy to begin with so the 5 minutes you wait for the app to handshake and enable the pump, you may as well have been filling and just walk in and pay. Truly useless app.
developerResponse:
{'id': 4787814, 'body': 'Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to contact BP. 

Sorry for the inconvenience. It sounds as though you were at one of our independently owned and operated BP stations. This means that payment methods may differ from other BP service stations. Can you advise of the station so we can pass your feedback on to the owner.

If you have any further queries regarding BPme, please contact us as below.


Kind regards,
BPme Customer Care

title: Had a visit from Police because of the advice I was given
review: Today I used your app, second time the app hasn’t worked for me. Great concept but created a lot more hassle for me. I drove out of my way so I didn’t need to get sleeping baby or 5yo out of the car. Payment didn’t go through and not wanting to get kids out of car I drove away from pump to store and called BPMe. I was advised they were having issues with PayPal payments and they’d send me a text as I wouldn’t be able to pay in store (confirmed by app) and I just pay them by directions on text. I later received a message from police to explain why I allegedly stole petrol. This was very stressful for me to have to explain this to the police in front of my children. I was told to go back to the station to pay. I am a busy working mother of 2 and when trying to save time and make my life a little easier it has actually been quite distressing and a lot of extra work me. Not worth the hassle.

{'id': 5364237, 'body': "Hi Alanna

Kind regards,

title: Pay more for your fuel
review: So I’ve used the app twice. A bit slow but perhaps saved some time paying when the cashier was busy. Third time I try it there’s a hitch! It tells me my transaction was declined after filling up. So I go in to the servo to pay. Cashier tells me all is good, system says it was paid, despite the email from BP. So I walk out and drive home. I pay within 2 hours but get hit with a recovery fee of $3!! Recovery of what BP? You got your money within 2 hours and would have had it within 30 seconds if your system was better. And you didn’t reply to my complaint email. Stop ripping people off! Can’t see me taking a chance to use the system again...

title: Once you work out it’s quirks, it’s amazing!
review: This app is amazing if you’re getting petrol and don’t want to/can’t go in to the service station to pay (baby in the car/ feeling antisocial/in your pyjamas etc). Can pay through PayPal so it’s easy and safe.  But it can be cumbersome until you figure out how best to use it. Tip:. Have the app running as you’re driving to the station. Then it has “located” the station by the time you drive up to it. Means you don’t have to wait around, once you’re parked, for the app to find the station and/or pumps. Speeds up the process!

title: When it works, it requires a lot of waiting in the car
review: Updated the review since I was able to successfully pay for my petrol. There is a lot of anxious waiting when using this app:. - waiting to login and be able to select a pump. - once the pump is selected, there is a longer waiting time for the pump to be “unlocked”. - after filling up, the longest wait was for the transaction to take place, which is the worst wait of all since 1) there is no other button/option to press so you’re just hoping your payment goes through, and 2) people are still unused to just getting straight into their cars without paying for petrol first. Similar to my initial sentiment, I would prefer to just pay for petrol the old-fashioned way than to use this app, unless I choose to remain in the car with the kids, eg thunderstorms. On a hot day I would probably take them out with me rather than to sit in the car that I cannot run the ignition on as I’ll be using the phone. Having said this, I’ll still keep an eye for future improvements as it does have potential. Thank you. ##########. Original review:. I, too, had high hopes for this app as it would potentially allow me to pay for petrol without having to take my kids out of the car, but testing it out by myself I could not get it to work; specifically it would give me a “technical error” when selecting a pump and ask me to try again, but it never worked so I ended up walking in to pay. I would like to echo other people’s experiences that it just takes too long with the engine off before you can even fill up (when it works, that is) so, until that is remediated, again I would not be considering using this with children in the car. I look forward to trying out the next version; hopefully BP will keep investing in this app.

title: Duplicate transactions
review: I have been using this App for a few months and it can gone well until recently. A charge for fuel was duplicated and it has taken an enormous amount of effort to try and have it reversed with no luck. Unfortunately I have had to escalate it as a disputed with my bank. I would highly caution putting your credit card details into the App as if you get double charged you will have terrible and inconvenience customer service from BP. There is a supposed phone number to call however BP Me is not an option and it is impossible to get a human on the line. I will no longer be using this App.

title: NOT worth the angst
review: Have used this App only 4 times, and 2 of them were a hassle. First time I paid for someone else’s fuel, but that was sorted quickly and locally. The last time the PayPay failed to verify payment, so I thought it would be easy to just pop inside and pay. When I went in they assured me payment HAD gone through I showed them the email, but they were happy it was settled. From then on I was bombarded with emails from BPme who demanded I give them my credit card details for payment. As I never give out my card details over the phone or internet I asked for an alternative payment method. Having to deal with their Customer ‘Care’ group is a nightmare and took way too much time to resolve. Avoid this App as it is CrApp and will not save you time or money. One star for the pretty colours.

title: Love it!
review: I downloaded the app so I wouldn’t have to get the baby out of the car to go inside to pay.  Admittedly it does take some time before you can start to pump your fuel but if you have a sleeping baby in the car, it’s so worth it. My only query would be why the station is allowed to exclude pumps from the app choice. Eg At my local BP I cannot choose pump 3 which is the cheapest fuel, I have to choose one of the other pumps with the more expensive fuel. Something I think would be great would be if you could use the app to pay for fuel even if you aren’t at the service station, in an emergency for a family member for example.  Also it would be nice if you could see that you can’t use the app before pulling up to the pump, sometimes I’ve bypassed a less expensive choice only to get to the BP and not be able to use the app. All in all I love it, my local is quite slow at activating the pump and processing the payment but it still beats unbuckling a sleeping baby!  I want all the other brands to get an app like this so when I can’t find a BP I can still pay from my car.

title: Velocity points needed
review: Please allow to enter your velocity number in the app so you get points with the app. Please add soon I hope in coming update!!. Thank you!
developerResponse:
{'id': 6170389, 'body': 'Hi there,

Thank you for taking the time to contact BP.  

BPme is free to download, however  as with many mobile payment apps, there is a $1 pre authorisation hold by your financial provider to ensure the method is valid every time you authorise a payment (regardless of its success or failure); this also occurs when you load your card into the app. This will be released by your financial provider. Your financial provider will be able to give you more information on how long it will take to be released, but generally for financial cards like VISA, AMEX and MasterCard, the pre authorisation hold will be released from the account within 3-10 business days. With all PayPal transactions, your account will show the $1 pre authorisation hold for 29 days and will feature as a pending payment in your account.

We suggest you contact your bank if you have further questions.

Kind regards,
BPme Customer Care
Phone: 1300 1300 27 (option 3 2 2 for BPme)', 'modified': '2018-11-30T00:26:21Z'}

title: Works fine most of the time but bug exists
review: So I wanted to use this APP in order to save time to avoid manual payment and avoid kids from getting out of the car to cashier. End up spending 20 mins + sorting out the issue this APP caused. It works perfectly fine if the pump can only be accessed from one side, so when your car is parked your pump is yours to use. But when the pump can be accessed from either side here comes the problem. I have just unlocked the pump in the car and about to fill up, the pump was lifted up by another customer from the opposite side. I went to the cashier and ask to cancel the BP me Payment straight away, but they can’t even see the transaction on the screen. There is no cancel option on the APP once it s unlocked and pump is lifted up. I ended up paying for somebody else who don’t have cash to pay me back and don’t have card to withdraw cash. What made it worst the cashier can’t treat it as cash out either. End up the person was understanding and nice and agreed to pay me through bank transfer. However the hassle it caused for both of us, I would never use this app again until this bug gets fixed. Not to mention I was now late for my appointment for 25 mins. Since there is no feedback option in BP station, I am sharing my not so pleasant experience here.
developerResponse: {'id': 13816120, 'body': 'Hi Al1ensX,\nThank you so much for the time you have taken in providing feedback on the BPme app.  We sincerely apologise for the inconvenience caused at our BP site using our app.  We would like to investigate this further for you, can you please contact us via aucustcare@bp.com and include your account details.  Thank you :-)\n', 'modified': '2020-03-02T22:56:44Z'}

title: Store Finder not reliable
review: App setup was easy.  But so far, the app has not been helpful to me- it didn’t find and give any info on the 7 common stations I use, and the 2 it could find can’t or won’t process payment by the app.   I think a 10+ character password is ridiculous, why not a 4+?  Main concern is the “Store Finder” function in the app does not show any of the 7 BP stations in my region (west Gippsland, VIC) or the one in my parents’ area that I use. (3029, VIC).  That was without any search filters applied too.  I initially had filters to look for BPme-enabled stations & BP Rewards stations but my stations of interest did not appear on map.  I removed the filters and they still did not display.  App REQUIRES device’s ‘Location Services’ to be ON in order to complete registration which I do not like- I would prefer to be able to register without Location Services, and then just manually enter a town name, or only activate Location Services manually for search if I was looking for a servo in an unfamiliar region where I didn’t know town name/s to enter.  I would prefer the Store Finder map to display ALL stations and just be able to zoom in to the area I was in, rather than having to enter town names or activate Location Services.  Also, I was extremely disappointed and surprised that two major stations on M1 Freeway (Officer, VIC) are not currently BPme-enabled!  It should be a business requirement than any station on an A-road (fwy/hwy) *must* have BPme facility.
developerResponse: {'id': 14474204, 'body': "Hi there, Really appreciate the time you've taken in providing your feedback.  We are so sorry for the inconvenience you've had using the location search.  Your query does help us improve our app and will pass on your feedback to our dev team.   Otherwise, I can suggest clearing cache and re installing the app.  If the issue still persists, please feel free to contact aucustcare@bp.com with your contact details, we would be happy to assist you. ", 'modified': '2020-04-06T03:00:19Z'}
review_basic_clean: App setup easy But far app helpful didnt find give info common station I use could find cant wont process payment app I think character password ridiculous Main concern Store Finder function app show BP station region west Gippsland VIC one parent area I use VIC That without search filter applied I initially filter look BPmeenabled station BP Rewards station station interest appear map I removed filter still display App REQUIRES device Location Services ON order complete registration I like I would prefer able register without Location Services manually enter town name activate Location Services manually search I looking servo unfamiliar region I didnt know town name enter I would prefer Store Finder map display ALL station able zoom area I rather enter town name activate Location Services Also I extremely disappointed surprised two major station M Freeway Officer VIC currently BPmeenabled It business requirement station Aroad fwyhwy must BPme facility

title: Login Verification
review: Hi,. Initially I had an issue register into this BPme app, most annoying part is the password, I doubt even my Gmail has such a complicated password & appreciate a minimum of 4digit password or Maximum of 10 digit password requirement with 1Capital & Numbers would be more than safe enough, Then the most annoying thing is that each time when we login it asks for a Verification code which we have to open up Emails over & over which is ridiculous even after saving the password you still need a verification... It’s not a banking system to be this much secured I guess... Once we used the velocity point scheme it was just easy & it’s just the matter of tapping the card... Well I gave 1 star leaving some room for the developers to improve & hope you’ll will continue to do good for the customers, on top of that wonder whether apple wallet option is added? 🤞
developerResponse: {'id': 14504941, 'body': "Hi there, thanks so much for your feedback. We will most certainly feed your login experience back to the BPme Technical Support team. BP Rewards in BPme is a new feature that allows you to earn either BP Points or Qantas Frequent Flyer Points every time you Pay for Fuel with BPme, or shop in store. If you'd like more information about the program, visit bprewards.com.au - you can use your BPme login to access the website and learn more. Thanks for your support!", 'modified': '2020-04-07T04:27:33Z'}

title: Great, until the issues set in
review: I’ve had this app twice now, by using 2 different email addresses. I’ve had to re-download the app and re-register with a different email address because it simply stopped working out of the blue one day. I sent an email to support but I was asked to send in so many technical answers, it was easier just to begin the whole process again. Second time around, same thing has happened. The idea is awesome, it’s so convenient not having to walk in to pay for fuel, but again, randomly, the app is “experiencing technical issues”. That’s all I get, no automatic email from BP explaining why my app won’t work or giving me a workaround, I’m expected to find a solution on my own or email support and answer questions that no one has time for. I’ve also often found myself waiting in my car, in the forecourt of BP for over 10 minutes whilst the clerk processes my payment inside, even though I can see the station is empty. Maybe when a customer is not standing in front of you, the sense of urgency is lessened, but that’s not the developer’s issue, although it certainly makes the app less convenient.
developerResponse: {'id': 15741791, 'body': 'Hi Anna, we apologise for the inconvenience caused. Please know we have shared your feedback with our technical team to resolve ASAP. Thanks for letting us know', 'modified': '2020-06-03T06:14:24Z'}

title: Woeful
review: Service station opening hours are not shown, which is the single most fundamental piece of information I would expect to see in this type of app. Even more frustratingly than saying nothing at all, the app teases “Closing Soon” for some service stations - indicating that data on opening hours is buried somewhere in the system, but just kept secret from potential customers for some unimaginable reason.  “Closing Soon” does not help when you’re trying to figure out whether to drive to a service station or not! Will it be closed in an hour? In 5 minutes? This app doesn’t tell you. Other information is also out of date / inconsistent. App shows a BP station being “Open now” near my house, despite that service station having been demolished for redevelopment several months ago. Admittedly there is a note within the “Location” (street address) for that service station which says it is “temporarily closed” but this just adds to the confusion; on a single screen, I can see that particular service station being noted as “Open now” AND “temporarily closed” AND “24 hours”?! Which one is it? Makes you question whether you can rely on this app at all on a long drive.
developerResponse: {'id': 16268707, 'body': 'Hi Eugene, thanks for your feedback.  We are sorry for the confusion, we had a technical issue with the app showing some BP sites being decommissioned which is incorrect.  This issue has now been rectified. ', 'modified': '2020-06-29T00:35:54Z'}
review_basic_clean: Service station opening hour shown single fundamental piece information I would expect see type app Even frustratingly saying nothing app tease Closing Soon service station indicating data opening hour buried somewhere system kept secret potential customer unimaginable reason Closing Soon help youre trying figure whether drive service station Will closed hour In minute This app doesnt tell Other information also date inconsistent App show BP station Open near house despite service station demolished redevelopment several month ago Admittedly note within Location street address service station say temporarily closed add confusion single screen I see particular service station noted Open AND temporarily closed AND hour Which one Makes question whether rely app long drive
Key Phrases: single most fundamental piece, Service station opening hours, particular service station, single screen, service stations, BP station, potential customers, unimaginable reason, street address, long drive, Other information, 24 hours, type, app, data, system, 5 minutes, date, house, redevelopment, note, Location, confusion

title: Great WHEN it works
review: Time saver and easy WHEN IT WORKS. When it DOESN’T:. wait forever in full 4GX service for the app to connect. wait for it to determine your location. wait again for it to re-connect to PayPal because it has lost the association to your account. Finally it connects and you log into PayPal and set it up again. WAIT more while it tries to connect to the pump. It tells you to hang on (real helpful). Eventually the pump unlocks, you get your fuel and it tells you to go inside because there’s been a problem with the transaction 😩. So after 10 mins parked to get 40 L of fuel you look like an idiot thanks to the quick and easy app.. Buuuut as you’re walking inside you see PP on your phone notify you you’ve been charged. SORT YOUR S—T out BP.
developerResponse: {'id': 16912826, 'body': 'Hi there, we are truly sorry for this experience. We have experienced some technical issues with the app, which have been resolved overnight.  You can also send a note to AUrewards@bp.com so that we can take a better look for you.  Apologies for any inconvenience.\r  \n', 'modified': '2020-07-28T02:22:20Z'}

title: Extremely disappointed
review: I filled up with petrol to try out the “Pay for Fuel” app and receive Qantas points offer. It was not a smooth process so I went inside and received advice on how to make the app work. I could fit in just $1 more so tried again but this time was told I should have waited longer before putting in petrol.  I gave up on BP and my Qantas points - a hopeless app so I’ll go back to Woolworths petrol in future. When entering card details on app, I was advised that $1 would be temporarily charged to authenticate card, but BP has taken $1 four times and won’t let me remove card details from app.  How much more money do they plan to steal?  STAY AWAY FROM THIS APP.

review: Useless app. BP offers 250 Qantas points for first time use, so the app guided me to the closest BP service station. Was more expensive than other brands but gave it a go. After fueling the app said there was a technical problem and should ask inside. Went inside where the cashier told me, that like many other BP in the app they were privately owned so no use of the app and no Qantas points. Thanks to the app I wasted 6 dollar and no points. Why does the app guide me to a non participating BP service station without warning ?

title: Glitchy app and terrible customer service
review: I first submitted a request for support in Sept 2020. The app had been working fine but then just froze on me. I uninstalled and installed multiple times, restarted, no luck. I have an iPhone 11 and am using the 4.20.0 version of the app. It’s 22 Dec 2020 and after multiple emails back and forth from customer service, I still can’t use the app. They’ve asked the same questions many times, and on the 13 Nov promised a “speedy resolution” and then I heard nothing for over a month until I called and started a new customer service request. Legitimately the worst customer support I’ve ever dealt with. Disappointing that such a big branch cannot invest the resources into getting this app right.

title: Needs more focus on primary use case
review: My biggest gripe with this app is around the load time.  My primary use (ie every week) is to simply scan my card when buying fuel - I rarely ever search for service stations and don’t have the option to use the payment functionality because it isn’t supported widely enough yet.  Opening the app take *far* too long and I then need to tap the card to get the barcode, while everyone behind me silently fumes.  *Integration with apple wallet would solve all that. * Too many times I’ve just given up and paid without scanning because it’s so slow.  Also many stations are listed as having 95 and don’t actually have it.

title: Logs out and slow
review: Incredibly frustrating app. Logs out of the account without warning so you try to use it either after you’ve paid if going inside or at the pump is trying to remotely and you can’t because you are then forced to go through a security log in process like It’s asking for the nuclear launch codes. Doesn’t show my transaction purchase history despite scanning it when it does decide to work. Logged my wife out and she had to sit for 15 minutes on a 40 degree day trying to make it work. Tried to log in via PayPal option but it then said was already a username to use that instead despite It showing as a different option when the account password didn’t work. Sends the verification to the email not the phone resulting in more drawn out verification to which point the phone overheated and couldn’t be used anyway. I compare this to the absolute ease of the 7/11 app and I happily use with much greater ease.

title: Think I'll switch back to Caltex
review: I've tried a few times to use the app after filling up at BP and am yet to successfully pay for fuel. Before I drove to BP I made sure I had a profile and was signed in (other reviews mention the subpar. sign up experience). I filled up, went to select my pump number and the discovered I couldn't select Apple Pay as a payment method like I could with Caltex. I had to scan in my credit card details or sign into PayPal. So I scanned my card details in, only to then find I was supposed to select the pump number in the app before filling up. In the end I just went inside to pay over the counter and the attendant explained what you're meant to do. I found it completely counter-intuitive and much preferred the Caltex app user experience. The app design is nice enough but I don't really care about extra tabs for rewards etc - just let me bang in a pump number, pay with apple pay like I do everything else and be on my way.

title: Not secure
review: My bank flagged this app as not secure and canceled my card that I had set up in the app
developerResponse:
{'id': 23190877, 'body': "Hi JEBFM, 

We are sorry to hear about your experience and can confirm that bp will never see nor store the details of your nominated cards. Such details are collected, stored and processed by bp's payment service providers, Braintree and PayPal, who process your purchases when you use the BPme app. For further information regarding Braintree and PayPal and how they encrypt and process payment transactions, see the Braintree and PayPal websites. You may find it helpful to have another conversation with your bank regarding your card. 

To learn more about BPme, please read the FAQs: https://www.bp.com/en_au/australia/home/products-services/bpme/faqs.html 
 
If you would like to keep in touch, could you please send any further details to our consumer relations team at aucustcare@bp.com. 

Thanks again for your feedback JEBFM, we really appreciate it.", 'modified': '2021-06-04T07:50:34Z'}
